channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Leveraging AI to improve human planning in large partially observable environments
item.description: To bridge this gap, we developed the first metareasoning algorithm for discovering resource-rational strategies for human planning in partially observable environments.

item.title: Federated Survival Forests
item.description: In this work, we present a novel federated algorithm for survival analysis based on one of the most successful survival models, the random survival forest.

item.title: Controllable Lexical Simplification for English
item.description: Fine-tuning Transformer-based approaches have recently shown exciting results on sentence simplification task.

item.title: MAP: Memory-aware Automated Intra-op Parallel Training For Foundation Models
item.description: However, finding an efficient distributed execution plan not only requires fine-grained model statistics, such as memory and computing overhead of each operator but also is a labor-intensive task even for an expert in the field of distributed training.

item.title: Domain-Indexing Variational Bayes: Interpretable Domain Index for Domain Adaptation
item.description: Previous studies have shown that leveraging domain index can significantly boost domain adaptation performance \cite{arXiv:2007. 01807, arXiv:2202. 03628}.

item.title: Trust, but Verify: Using Self-Supervised Probing to Improve Trustworthiness
item.description: Trustworthy machine learning is of primary importance to the practical deployment of deep learning models.

item.title: Learning Representations of Bi-Level Knowledge Graphs for Reasoning beyond Link Prediction
item.description: We define a bi-level knowledge graph that consists of the base-level and the higher-level triplets.

item.title: Energy-based Out-of-Distribution Detection for Graph Neural Networks
item.description: This paves a way for a simple, powerful and efficient OOD detection model for GNN-based learning on graphs, which we call GNNSafe.

item.title: Probabilistic Contrastive Learning Recovers the Correct Aleatoric Uncertainty of Ambiguous Inputs
item.description: We prove that these distributions recover the correct posteriors of the data-generating process, including its level of aleatoric uncertainty, up to a rotation of the latent space.

item.title: INCREASE: Inductive Graph Representation Learning for Spatio-Temporal Kriging
item.description: It aims to infer knowledge for (the things at) unobserved locations using the data from (the things at) observed locations during a given time period of interest.

item.title: Guide the Learner: Controlling Product of Experts Debiasing Method Based on Token Attribution Similarities
item.description: A popular workaround is to train a robust model by re-weighting training examples based on a secondary biased model.

item.title: Optimal Transport Guided Unsupervised Learning for Enhancing low-quality Retinal Images
item.description: In this paper, we proposed a simple but effective end-to-end framework for enhancing poor-quality retinal fundus images.

item.title: LoFT: Enhancing Faithfulness and Diversity for Table-to-Text Generation via Logic Form Control
item.description: Logical Table-to-Text (LT2T) generation is tasked with generating logically faithful sentences from tables.

item.title: MixFormer: End-to-End Tracking with Iterative Mixed Attention
item.description: Our core design is to utilize the flexibility of attention operations, and propose a Mixed Attention Module (MAM) for simultaneous feature extraction and target information integration.

item.title: Neural Collapse Inspired Feature-Classifier Alignment for Few-Shot Class Incremental Learning
item.description: In this paper, we deal with this misalignment dilemma in FSCIL inspired by the recently discovered phenomenon named neural collapse, which reveals that the last-layer features of the same class will collapse into a vertex, and the vertices of all classes are aligned with the classifier prototypes, which are formed as a simplex equiangular tight frame (ETF).

item.title: 1st Place Solution for PSG competition with ECCV'22 SenseHuman Workshop
item.description: Panoptic Scene Graph (PSG) generation aims to generate scene graph representations based on panoptic segmentation instead of rigid bounding boxes.

item.title: PatchDCT: Patch Refinement for High Quality Instance Segmentation
item.description: To further refine masks obtained by compressed vectors, we propose for the first time a compressed vector based multi-stage refinement framework.

item.title: TR3D: Towards Real-Time Indoor 3D Object Detection
item.description: Our model with early feature fusion, which we refer to as TR3D+FF, outperforms existing 3D object detection approaches on the SUN RGB-D dataset.

item.title: CHiLS: Zero-Shot Image Classification with Hierarchical Label Sets
item.description: Open vocabulary models (e. g.

item.title: Top-Down Beats Bottom-Up in 3D Instance Segmentation
item.description: Most 3D instance segmentation methods exploit a bottom-up strategy, typically including resource-exhaustive post-processing.

item.title: Toward Large Kernel Models
item.description: Recent studies indicate that kernel machines can often perform similarly or better than deep neural networks (DNNs) on small datasets.

item.title: Perception Datasets for Anomaly Detection in Autonomous Driving: A Survey
item.description: Deep neural networks (DNN) which are employed in perception systems for autonomous driving require a huge amount of data to train on, as they must reliably achieve high performance in all kinds of situations.

item.title: MuG: A Multimodal Classification Benchmark on Game Data with Tabular, Textual, and Visual Fields
item.description: Multimodal learning has attracted the interest of the machine learning community due to its great potential in a variety of applications.

item.title: Target-based Surrogates for Stochastic Optimization
item.description: Our target optimization framework uses the (expensive) gradient computation to construct surrogate functions in a target space (e. g. the logits output by a linear model for classification) that can be minimized efficiently.

item.title: Dropout Injection at Test Time for Post Hoc Uncertainty Quantification in Neural Networks
item.description: Among Bayesian methods, Monte-Carlo dropout provides principled tools for evaluating the epistemic uncertainty of neural networks.

item.title: Learning Control-Oriented Dynamical Structure from Data
item.description: Even for known nonlinear dynamical systems, feedback controller synthesis is a difficult problem that often requires leveraging the particular structure of the dynamics to induce a stable closed-loop system.

item.title: RLSbench: Domain Adaptation Under Relaxed Label Shift
item.description: Meanwhile, popular deep domain adaptation heuristics tend to falter when faced with shifts in label proportions.

item.title: Unleashing the True Potential of Sequence-to-Sequence Models for Sequence Tagging and Structure Parsing
item.description: Sequence-to-Sequence (S2S) models have achieved remarkable success on various text generation tasks.

item.title: Achieving Robust Generalization for Wireless Channel Estimation Neural Networks by Designed Training Data
item.description: In this paper, we propose a method to design the training data that can support robust generalization of trained neural networks to unseen channels.

item.title: Hatemongers ride on echo chambers to escalate hate speech diffusion
item.description: We analyze more than 32 million posts from over 6. 8 million users across three popular online social networks to investigate the interrelations between hateful behavior, information dissemination, and polarised organization mediated by echo chambers.

item.title: Contrast with Reconstruct: Contrastive 3D Representation Learning Guided by Generative Pretraining
item.description: This motivates us to learn 3D representations by sharing the merits of both paradigms, which is non-trivial due to the pattern difference between the two paradigms.

item.title: Sample Dropout: A Simple yet Effective Variance Reduction Technique in Deep Policy Optimization
item.description: Recent success in Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) methods has shown that policy optimization with respect to an off-policy distribution via importance sampling is effective for sample reuse.

item.title: FastPillars: A Deployment-friendly Pillar-based 3D Detector
item.description: The deployment of 3D detectors strikes one of the major challenges in real-world self-driving scenarios.

item.title: Pyramid Self-attention Polymerization Learning for Semi-supervised Skeleton-based Action Recognition
item.description: Most semi-supervised skeleton-based action recognition approaches aim to learn the skeleton action representations only at the joint level, but neglect the crucial motion characteristics at the coarser-grained body (e. g., limb, trunk) level that provide rich additional semantic information, though the number of labeled data is limited.

item.title: Leaving Reality to Imagination: Robust Classification via Generated Datasets
item.description: We find that Imagenet classifiers trained on real data augmented with generated data achieve higher accuracy and effective robustness than standard training and popular augmentation strategies in the presence of natural distribution shifts.

item.title: Revisiting Discriminative vs. Generative Classifiers: Theory and Implications
item.description: Theoretically, the paper considers the surrogate loss instead of the zero-one loss in analyses and generalizes the classical results from binary cases to multiclass ones.

item.title: TempEL: Linking Dynamically Evolving and Newly Emerging Entities
item.description: For that study, we introduce TempEL, an entity linking dataset that consists of time-stratified English Wikipedia snapshots from 2013 to 2022, from which we collect both anchor mentions of entities, and these target entities' descriptions.

item.title: On the Role of Contrastive Representation Learning in Adversarial Robustness: An Empirical Study
item.description: However, adversarial fine-tuning is not very effective for supervised contrastive learning and supervised learning schemes.

item.title: Run-Off Election: Improved Provable Defense against Data Poisoning Attacks
item.description: Instead, we propose Run-Off Election (ROE), a novel aggregation method based on a two-round election across the base models: In the first round, models vote for their preferred class and then a second, Run-Off election is held between the top two classes in the first round.

item.title: Guaranteed Tensor Recovery Fused Low-rankness and Smoothness
item.description: Recent research have made significant progress by adopting two insightful tensor priors, i. e., global low-rankness (L) and local smoothness (S) across different tensor modes, which are always encoded as a sum of two separate regularization terms into the recovery models.

item.title: Revisiting Image Deblurring with an Efficient ConvNet
item.description: In this work, we propose a unified lightweight CNN network that features a large effective receptive field (ERF) and demonstrates comparable or even better performance than Transformers while bearing less computational costs.

item.title: How Many and Which Training Points Would Need to be Removed to Flip this Prediction?
item.description: To our knowledge, this is the first work in to investigate the problem of identifying a minimal training set necessary to flip a given prediction in the context of machine learning.

item.title: REaLTabFormer: Generating Realistic Relational and Tabular Data using Transformers
item.description: It first creates a parent table using an autoregressive GPT-2 model, then generates the relational dataset conditioned on the parent table using a sequence-to-sequence (Seq2Seq) model.

item.title: Neural Time Series Analysis with Fourier Transform: A Survey
item.description: However, although increasing attention has been attracted and research is flourishing in this emerging area, there lacks a systematic review of the variety of existing studies in the area.

item.title: Contrastive Collaborative Filtering for Cold-Start Item Recommendation
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a novel model called Contrastive Collaborative Filtering for Cold-start item Recommendation (CCFCRec), which capitalizes on the co-occurrence collaborative signals in warm training data to alleviate the issue of blurry collaborative embeddings for cold-start item recommendation.

item.title: Real-Time Image Demoireing on Mobile Devices
item.description: In this paper, we launch the first study on accelerating demoireing networks and propose a dynamic demoireing acceleration method (DDA) towards a real-time deployment on mobile devices.

item.title: A neural operator-based surrogate solver for free-form electromagnetic inverse design
item.description: Neural operators have emerged as a powerful tool for solving partial differential equations in the context of scientific machine learning.

item.title: Efficient End-to-End Video Question Answering with Pyramidal Multimodal Transformer
item.description: This paper presents a new method for end-to-end Video Question Answering (VideoQA), aside from the current popularity of using large-scale pre-training with huge feature extractors.

item.title: Explicit Box Detection Unifies End-to-End Multi-Person Pose Estimation
item.description: This paper presents a novel end-to-end framework with Explicit box Detection for multi-person Pose estimation, called ED-Pose, where it unifies the contextual learning between human-level (global) and keypoint-level (local) information.

item.title: ShadowFormer: Global Context Helps Image Shadow Removal
item.description: It is still challenging for the deep shadow removal model to exploit the global contextual correlation between shadow and non-shadow regions.
